intro: Rosa transitoria, commonly known as the transitory rose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender stems covered in soft, glandular hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and often have a distinctive silvery-white underside. Rosa transitoria thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks.
